snippet: Many are arrested in the looting of stores since Hurricane Sandy hit, a 7 percent rise in burglary complaints from Monday through Thursday, compared with the same period last year.
abstract: New York City Police Dept officials report a 7 percent rise in burglary complaints following Hurricane Sandy, attributable to reports of looting that have come in across the city; overall, reported crime is down, although some police officials caution that a full accounting is not yet possible.
lead_paragraph: Many are arrested in the looting of stores since Hurricane Sandy hit, a 7 percent rise in burglary complaints from Monday through Thursday, compared with the same period last year.

headline.seo: A Rise in Burglary Reports Follows Storm
headline.main: Burglaries Are Up After Storm, City Police Say, While Other Crimes Have Dropped
headline.print_headline: Burglaries Are Up After Storm, City Police Say, While Other Crimes Have Dropped
